alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 12:49PM MST until January 13 at 7:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches will locally higher amounts up to 3 inches. Winds gusting 35 to 45 mph with locally higher gusts. * WHERE...Central Yampa River Basin. * WHEN...Until 7 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially in open areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of gusty winds and snow could lead to brief whiteout conditions in the advised area.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
